title: Understanding Reaction Spontaneity
text: A reaction is spontaneous when its Gibbs free energy change ΔG is negative. The relation between Gibbs free energy, enthalpy, and entropy is given by the equation: ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - T ΔS .

title: Standard Gibbs Free Energy Change
text: The standard Gibbs free energy change ΔG° at 298K is given in the problem as $$-32.89$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$. Remember, we're looking for the point where ΔG $$=$$ $$0$$ .

title: Finding Standard Entropy
text: We need to calculate ΔS° (standard entropy change):\n[ΔS° $$=$$ (ΔH° - ΔG°)/T]Use the given information to find ΔS° .

title: Calculating Standard Enthalpy Change
text: Calculate the standard enthalpy change ΔH° using the heats of formation in $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$:\n[ΔH° $$=$$ ΔH°_f(C_2H_6) - (ΔH°_f(C_2H_4) + ΔH°_f(H_2))]

title: Solving for Standard Entropy Change
text:
Using the relationship ΔG° $$=$$ ΔH° - TΔS° , solve for ΔS° :
[ΔS° $$=$$ (ΔH° - ΔG°)/T]
Given:
- ΔH° $$=$$ $$-137.15$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
- ΔG° $$=$$ $$-32.89$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
- T $$=$$ $$298$$ K

title: Finding the Temperature for Spontaneity
text:
Now solve the equation when the reaction becomes spontaneous (ΔG $$=$$ $$0$$ ):
[0 $$=$$ ΔH° - TΔS°]
Solve for T :
[T $$=$$ ΔH°/ΔS°]
